title: Sustainable Agriculture: A Better Way to Feed The World? | A Thrivable Life Podcast | Episode 05

subtasks: Defining sustainable agriculture.
Explaining the transition challenges faced by farmers moving towards sustainable practices.
Discussing the challenges of converting to sustainable agriculture (knowledge, funding, buyer demand, appearance).
Addressing the balance between commercial agriculture and sustainable methods on a large scale.
Examining the role of technology (e.g., precision agriculture, AI) in supporting sustainable farming.
Discussing traditional sustainable farming practices (e.g., no-till, crop rotation).
Highlighting the benefits of local and direct-market produce.
Considering the impact of weather conditions on crop selection and sustainability.
Highlighting innovative practices like seaweed farming for sustainability.
Identifying consumer actions to support sustainable agriculture (seasonal eating, education, policy support).
